name: The Beehive

reviews.title: The best place in Rome
reviews.text: The Beehive is the perfect place to relax after sightseeing in Rome. I stayed in the dorm room with other 7 strange people, but it seems its calm atmosphere is countagious and only nice people were there: both guests and employees. Besides, it's in a great location (very near Termini station) and it's very clean. I really don't have anything to complain about this hotel.
Stayed with family for six nights and was extremely satisfied with the place. Very clean, quiet, cheerful and in an excellent location. No problems whatever.
reviews.title: Excellent
Went back three times
reviews.text: Found the Beehive from reviews on this site

more than lived up to expectations. We went back three time in our 5 weeks in italy. We stayed in the Millefliori Apartment for a week. Spacious, very clean you have your own high ceiling room with fan and share kitchen and bathroom, short walk from main station and food store. Worked like a charm. Seedy district but we knew that and it was quite safe. Stayed one night at another of the apartments the Acacia again fine but no dining area so not as friendly a set up. Also stayed twice at the Beehive itself just great. All very very clean, very helpful staff. They give you an info booklet that saved us time and money, like our day trip to Orvieto also you get a map with the way to the apartments. It is a very short walk from the train from the airport and we will use them every time we come to Rome we will come again no doubt.
reviews.title: Great place!

reviews.text: We loved the Beehive! We only stayed there one night, the last night of our trip (it is close to Termini train station). It is very clean and comfortable. It was the best place we stayed at our entire trip, and the cheapest! The staff seemed nice, and we really enjoyed their cafe downstairs. It's a great place to relax and talk with other guests.
reviews.title: the apartments!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We found this place through a friend's recommendation and found it to be a clean, safe haven from the hectic streets of Rome. I really liked the promotion of healthy eating and recycling too. We stayed 1 night in a dorm and 2 nights in a private room and found both were brilliant. The other residents were so quiet I was surprised to wake up to empty beds around me!
reviews.title: Very Clean and Great Value

likes.disliked: — Minor - 1 member of staff a little hard to get help from. Again, this is minor

reviews.title: Bedbugs! Stay away!!!
reviews.text: The resident cat called Ingar is very friendly - and as a consequence probably fat!
This place is a no-brainer, choose it !!
reviews.title: Hot Find!

likes.liked: — Cafe, friendliness of guests and staff

reviews.text: Stayed in one of the apartments. The apartment was nice but no toilet paper, the internet access didn't work and it was in a very bad area!!! The apartments are on the other side of the tracks from the hostel so to get toilet paper or anythign else you have to walk many blocks to the hostel. To register, you leave the terminal, go to the hostel, pay, go back through the terminal and fiund the apartments. Okay, not so bad if you have a couple of hours to waste after a long trip to get there and want to rest..... But the kicker is that when we went to sleep we were eaten alive by bed bugs!!! Let me tell you, it's not like a little bite, they suck your blood and we were itching for a week! Nice. Really enjoyable. I contacted the owenr of the hostel and he said they have had trouble in the past with bedbugs but they had taken care of it and we must have been mistaken. Yeah, I'm mistaken about having bug bites all over me. I cancelled the rest of our stay and had to fight for our money back because they refused to take our cancellation because of lack of notification over 24 hours. Sorry, I wasn't notified that I would be the meal for their bugs. I finally got my money back because I used my credit card and I requested a chargeback. Yeah, they fought and kicked and complained to my bank but in the end they lost. Stay away!
reviews.title: Excellent find!!!
Millefiori Apartment
reviews.text: We stayed at The Beehive at the end of June, 2006. Upon arriving in Rome and walking through The Beehvie's sketchy neighborhood, we were not expecting much (and were actually considering changing our reservation) but thankfully, the hotel/hostel is everything described on TripAdvisor and The Beehive's website, and MORE. The thick garden wall and security door provide safety in a truly questionable neighborhood, the staff is helpful and friendly, and the whole feel of the place is trendy and fun! We stayed in the dorm room, which I was hesitant about at first, but everyone was polite and quiet, and it ended up being a great way to save money. The highlight of The Beehive was certainly Francesca's cafe' downstairs. The food was tasty and healthy, and Francesca facilitated helpful and informative conversation among the guests. We made some new friends and got lots of travel tips. Don't miss her cafe', even if you don't stay at The Beehive. Yum! Our only concern was the lack of air conditioning. It's HOT in Rome, and this did make things a little unbearable at times, BUT, don't miss The Beehive for this one little hang up. Check it out- you won't be disappointed!

reviews.title: Numerous advantages may outweigh one disadvantage
reviews.text: Rome was our last stop on our Tour de Europe and we were really looking forward to a place run by fellow Americans. Although it is very convienient to the train station, we had trouble finiding it at first, Roman street numbers aren't exactly visible or in order-just look for the clock that says "Enjoy Rome" and you are close. The facility itself is nice, marble floors and big sink in the bedroom. A kitchen on the lower level, plenty of bathrooms/showers. A absoultely priceless guide on local restaurants/sites/scams/etc, big fluffy towels and some of the best handsoap ever were provided to us. Our only complaint was that it was loud. The hotel is one part of a large apartment building and you can hear everything that happens in the courtyard all night long. Sound travels very well in the hallways too and we could hear whenever anyone walked by or was talking in the lobby. There is also a buzzer to let guests in and we heard that all night long too. We aren't light sleepers either. However, that is my only complaint. If I had some earplugs and Ambien I would have been a happy camper. The staff were great and only too happy to help.

Easy to get to form the train station and a good starting point for exploring Rome in every direction. It was safe, clean, comfortable and spacious not to mention a very good value. We stayed 5 nights in a private room with a sink on the corner of the main floor and it was more the I had expected. I would stay here again for sure.
reviews.title: sweet as honey
Millifiori Apt. (Beehive Property)
reviews.text: The Millifiori Apt. is conveniently located near the train station. My 3 sisters and I stayed in the dorm room, 3 other ladies in another room, a married couple in the 3rd room. Long wait for the bathroom, but very clean. Nice little well furnished kitchen, and large dining room/central area. Iron/ironing board useful. Hairdryer, too. Computer and Internet a plus! The smallest elevator I've ever seen (very cute!). Inexpensive for Rome, a good value.
-The 4 sisters from Pacific Northwest
reviews.title: Great Budget Hotel

reviews.text: We stayed here for two nights after travelling for a week. Was lovely to be somewhere so clean, tidy and comfortable. It is a budget hotel which might not suit everyone, shared bathrooms, staff enthusiastic rather than professional, no minibar, buffet breakfast etc. but for the independent traveller or those who dont like big hotels it will be perfect. Very handily located for the train station.
reviews.title: Fantastic!

reviews.text: The Beehive is a small budget hotel/hostel very close to the Termini train station in Rome. It is a bit of a walk to the tourist sights of Rome - but being close to the station means not having to lug your bags very far. The walk to the Trevi Fountain area is easy and safe at night (about 15-20 min) even for a woman alone.
reviews.title: Excellent value

likes.liked: — Close to train station, seem to be very eco-friendly

reviews.text: I stayed in the dorm room - 8 bunk beds in a very large, airy room. The other guests were very quiet. The bed was of average comfort. The shared bathroom was extremely clean, but not the best water pressure (and no hot water the day I left).
reviews.title: Great place!

reviews.text: The staff was friendly and helpful - they give you a GREAT map (better than my Streetwise) and booklet with recommendations - very useful.
reviews.title: Spectacular Stay at the Beehive

likes.liked: — Staff, security, cafe, friendly atmosphere, free towels

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast isn't included, but inexpensive if you just want to get some toast, juice, coffee, etc.
reviews.title: Liked the beehive with a few exceptions

reviews.text: The dorm beds are a great value - cheaper than other hostels in Rome yet much nicer.
reviews.title: Almost Perfect except for Shower Facilities

description: The Beehive is a stylish, budget, eco-conscious hotel/hostel owned by an American couple, Linda & Steve, who came to Rome to follow a dream. In 1999 we packed up our apartment in Los Angeles and, along with our 2 cats moved to Rome and opened The Beehive, a unique cross between a budget hotel and an upscale hostel - a place where you can feel at home. Everything about The Beehive Hotel reflects our own personal values - we're conscious about the environment, passionate about social issues, and genuinely want to be helpful and hospitable. We love to share the kind of information that helps you get the most out of your travels. Over the years The Beehive has evolved along with us and our many repeat guests. With our amazing onsite staff and manager, all of our guests receive our dedication and effort to helping you get the best out of your holiday. As always, we want you to know you have a safe haven and friends in Rome.
